DOC.detailed_description: Smoking large preventable cause disease premature death United States . Adolescent smoke great predictor adult smoking associate adverse health effect adolescence . Twenty-two percent high school student report current smoking ( past 30 day ) . As primary health professional school setting , school nurse tremendous opportunity play key role treat adolescent smoker . A randomized control trial ( RCT ) conduct investigator 71 high school Massachusetts demonstrate feasibility school nurse deliver four-session individual counseling intervention adolescent want stop smoking potential efficacy increase self-reported short term ( 6-week 3-month ) quit rate . Although promising , preliminary study lack biochemical validation long-term follow-up maintenance intervention effect , conduct primarily white student population . This application seek evaluate effectiveness intervention use rigorous methodology , include biochemical validation self-reported smoking behavior longer-term follow-up ( 6 12 month post-intervention ) , study design compare intervention information attention-control condition , recruitment ethnically diverse school increase generalizability finding . The overall aim propose study conduct randomize control school-based trial ( RCT ) evaluate effectiveness school nurse-delivered smoking cessation intervention increase 30 day abstinence rate among high school student smoke . Forty high school serve diverse student population recruit randomly assign one two condition : ( 1 ) Special Intervention ( SI ) - four 30-minute individual patient-centered smoking cessation counsel intervention session base Public Health Service ( PHS ) clinical practice guideline deliver school nurse ; ( 2 ) Information Only ( IO ) attention-control comparison condition - four individual session school nurse check smoke status deliver standardize series informational pamphlet smoke cessation . Participant assessment occur study entry ( baseline ) 3-,12-month follow-up .
